bill_title: to make an appropriation for certain higher education grant programs.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to make an appropriation for certain higher education grant programs. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That House Bill 1176 as previously enacted by the Seventy-second Legislative Assembly be amended as follows: On page 11, line 28 of the enacted bill, delete the first $2,316,000 and insert $2,010,867. Adjust all totals accordingly. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of one hundred twenty-seven thousand six hundred thirty-three dollars ($127,633), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs to provide state student incentive grants to qualified students in universities under the control of the Board of Regents pursuant to chapter 13-55A, and one hundred fifty thousand dollars ($150,000) of federal expenditure authority, or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs to provide state student incentive grants to qualified students in accredited post-secondary institutions in South Dakota pursuant to chapter 13-55A. Section 3. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of one hundred twenty-seven thousand five hundred dollars ($127,500), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs to provide the tuition equalization grants to qualified students in private colleges pursuant to chapter 13-55B. Section 4. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of fifty thousand dollars ($50,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs to provide grants to Cheyenne River Community College in Eagle Butte, Oglala Lakota College in Kyle, Sinte Gleska University in Rosebud, Sitting Bull College in Mobridge, and Sisseton-Wahpeton Community College in Sisseton, provided the institutions maintain accreditation by the North Central Association of Colleges and Secondary Schools. Section 5. The grant to each institution as provided for in section 4 of this Act shall be determined as follows: (1) The Department of Education and Cultural Affairs shall determine the total credit- hour enrollment for the 1996-97 school year at each institution; (2) The grant to each institution shall be the appropriation in section 4 of this Act multiplied by each institution's proportionate share of the total credit hours identified in step (1). Section 6. Any institution receiving a grant pursuant to section 4 of this Act shall provide the department a copy of the institution's nondiscrimination policy whereby the institution does not engage in and will discipline acts of discrimination on the basis of race, sex, religion, or natural origin in regards to its employment practices. Section 7. The secretary of the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 8. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 1998, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21.

BILL HISTORY 3/25/97 First read in House and referred to committee assignment waived. H.J. 969
